problem: Calculate the net torque about the axle of the wheel shown in the figure. Assume that a friction torque of 0.60 m·N opposes the motion.

correctFormulas.name: Torque from perpendicular force
correctFormulas.formula: τ = r F (sign from rotation sense)

steps.explanation: Assign counterclockwise torques as positive; evaluate each applied force’s moment.
Add the friction torque (opposite the motion, i.e., positive) to obtain the net torque.
steps.notations: τ₍net₎ = −1.8 N·m + 0.60 N·m = −1.2 N·m → 1.2 N·m clockwise
